Class Cinema

java.lang.Object
  Cinema

public class Cinema
extends java.lang.Object

This Cinema class is representive of a single cinema object. It stores an Array List of screens and how many screens this particular cinema contains.

Version:
15/03/2012
Author:
Craig Wilson, Todd Perry, Sam Borni

Constructor Detail

Cinema

public Cinema()
       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Constructs a Cinema class. Fills it with the default number of screens (in this case, 4) and fills those screens with a randomly generated film schedule.

Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

public void displayCinemaSchedule(int screenID)

Parameters:

getNoOfScreens

public int getNoOfScreens()
The method getNoOfScreens returns the number of screens currently in this cinema object. By default, it is set to 4.

Returns:
An integer stating the number of screens in the cinema.
